content: It hasn't been very clear to me whether there's an official rule about the QA information (not error or warning) messages for IG publication. Do they need to be resolved? Can they be ignored? Or do only some of them need to be resolved, and does that depend on which particular messages they are?
The QA is expected to be clean unless Grahame says it's a tooling issue that a) can't be fixed before ballot/publication; and b) that tooling issue is not significant to the ballot/publication

If there are warning or info messages where you've reviewed and agreed that everything is correct, you can add the messages to the ignoreWarnings.txt file (or whatever the equivalent is in @Eric Haas's framework) so they don't bug you.
well the new IG publisher just released gives a ton more build errors than there were before. I'm afraid to re-run the ones I already did...
yes, quite a few more :( - looking at what do about them
There's a reference to icon_fixed.gif that I can't find anywhere, that's the source for many of them in my IGs. Anyone have an icon_fixed.gif?
@Lynn Laakso, see the other threads.
